reviews.text: Booked via PL for 75$. And for that price, got a good deal. Checked in around 11h00Am and service was courteous. They only had pet friendly room when I arrived, but was told that they are well cleaned (I am allergic to animal hair) and could be moved to another room later, if needed. The room was indeed clean, no reactions, and was ample and sunny, with a nice king bed, a good 2 place sofa and ottoman, nice LCD TV, free wifi, decent sized bathroom. Was also given some vouchers for breakfast, which I could not use due to early departure time. I didn't visit the gym or pool, given I was out most of the day. The parking is not expensive (15$ for valet, a good deal) and did not experience the garage itself. The area itself is in walking distance to a nice pedestrian mall, with a farmers market on Saturday, and good restaurants. I liked this place.
reviews.title: Nice hotel in the warm heart of Knoxville

reviews.text: Me and a buddy met in Knoxville for weekend. Hotel is in great location, very accessible to interstate for trip in and out of city. Was in walking distance (couple blocks) to Market Square, which is a pedestrian friendly area of downtown containing restaurants, shops, and bars. The lobby has been updated to Hilton standards, but room were a bit dated. Parking garage on site, rate was $12/day. Would stay here again.
reviews.title: Excellent location, right off interstate and close to Market Square

reviews.text: I have stayed in this hotel on three occasions, each time the staff have been very helpful. The reservations are always right, the rooms are always ready and clean. the bellman and the valet or helpful and prompt. the executive lounge is well apointed and welcoming. This is a good hotel.
reviews.title: Great Staff

reviews.text: just stayed at this hotel for a UT home game. The hotel is updated, wonderful attentive staff, nice little hotel bar and cafe, starbucks on site, great location. The room was very comfortable and decorated nicely. Bathroom was TINY! My only complaints are the speed of the elevators....I waited almost 15 minutes for one on one of the mornings! I know its a large hotel and can be busy - but 15 minutes for an elevator was ridiculous!! And the other complaint was the noise. Granted...it was a home football game and there was of course extra party goers in the hotel... however, not only could I hear people in the hallways... I could actually hear the person in the room above us going ot the bathroom! I'm sure it is just because it is an old hotel... I would stay here again definitely...
reviews.title: decent hotel - great location - fantastic staff - but very thin walls!

reviews.text: I stay in hotels approx 10 nights a month. The Hilton in downtown Knoxville is my favorite place to stay in Knoxville. Clean rooms, good workout facility, and very friendly staff. Valet parking is the best option in parking since self parking makes for a long walk sometimes. A good choice for a hotel in Knoxville.
reviews.title: Good choice in Knoxville

reviews.text: I booked a stay well in advance under a corporate rate and as a Hilton Honors Gold member. Plans changed, and I was only going to be able to stay the 2nd of the two nights. I contacted the contract manager to ask about keeping the reservation, but for one night, and had to leave a voicemail with her. One of her colleagues replied back to me, instead, and my conversation with him was rather unprofessional:
reviews.title: Poor Management

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I inquired about only staying the 2nd night, and was told I would have to cancel the reservation and rebook. Well, the cost of that one night (Saturday) was going to be MORE than the Friday AND Saturday rate I had previously booked... by about $100. Of course I wasn’t going to do this. Hypothetically, I asked what happens if I come the first night but leave before the 2nd. I was informed I would still get my original, cheaper rate. Say what? I asked why this was and did not get an answer from him, but instead he essentially told me I wasn’t even deserving of this rate since it’s no longer able to be booked like this. His replies were very short and rude. I asked a few more questions, and still got the run-around, and was ultimately asked if I wanted to cancel the reservation. I told him “no, if it comes to that then I will cancel myself online and stay at other hotels in Knoxville from now on.”
reviews.title: Good convention hotel, nice stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Fast forward to the stay, which I ended up keeping, as I go to check in at the front desk and find out my reservation has been canceled. Say what? The Hilton rep had canceled my reservation without my authorization. I received no email or other notice about this cancelation. The front desk clerk was able to revive the reservation, fortunately, but I can’t believe this manager/supervisor had the audacity to do something like that.
reviews.title: Nice Stay - Needs minor improvements

reviews.text: I called the original contract manager again, leaving a voicemail, and did not hear anything back from her. I was transferred to the Property Manager’s voicemail, and did not hear anything back from him. None of my emails have been given a reply, either. As professional as I have been in my attempts to contact them, I have not received the same professionalism from any of those managers. I waited more than two months to write this review, as well, giving them ample time to reply to me.
reviews.title: Good hotel except for smoking on 9th floor

reviews.text: As for the rest of the staff, they have always been courteous, caring, and welcoming, with each stay I have logged here - even when I was not an elite member. It’s a shame that some of their management team don’t display that same amount of care towards their customers.
reviews.title: Nice location but.....

reviews.text: Excellent location. Pretty lobby. Garage is not exactly connected and not owned by the hotel. Often full. The non-smoking room smelled from smoke (they never clean the air conditioning filters). The paint was wearing off the toilet seat. The complimentary breakfast was poor, the "short order cook" was indifferent if not down right nasty, while the waiter was wonderful.The manager was very nice. I was sorry that I had to discuss the hotel problems with her. You can do better.
reviews.title: Really Bad Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My wife and I recently stayed at the Hilton in Knoxville as part of a driving tour of Tenessee. The room was a typical 2 double bed standard room, but everything worked. The pluses were a full Starbucks in the lobby, an excellent buffet breakfast, convenient self-parking next door to the hotel, and the fact that the hotel is 2 short blocks from Chesapeake's, which may be the best seafood restaurant in Knoxville.
reviews.title: Good buffet breakfast, good coffe

likes.liked: — Buffet breakfast; full service Starbucks in hotel lobby

reviews.text: Our stay at The Hilton Knoxville was a mixed one. The check-in was very smooth and quick 'cos being a Hilton Honors Member helped a lot. Our room was not ready but 'cos we checked earlier than expected, they had another room set up for us. We were relieved as we had driven a long way to get to Knoxville. The room is clean and cool and every thing was in place.
reviews.title: Great hotel!

likes.disliked: — The restaurant in the hotel - horrible!!

reviews.text: The only thing I didn't like was the restaurant on site. Don't eat there. The food was terrible.
reviews.title: Stay Elsewhere!

reviews.text: I stayed at the Knoxville Hilton July 8-11, 2007. The hotel is obviously old despite efforts to update its appearance. The main lobby was fairly nice. However, I was very disappointed with the cleanliness of the hotel rooms. The bathroom was clean, but not spotless. A wash cloth that had been used by a previous guest had been left in the shower. The carpets smelled kind of musky. I requested a refrigerator for the room and the one that was brought up was old, beaten, and rusty in places. I was also told there was no charge for its use and then billed $5 per night for it. The pillowcases on the pillows were stained all over. The parking deck was not supervised or monitored, but did cost $8-$12 per night. I did not feel safe in it at night. The 3 elevators were very slow and ice machines only worked on 2 of the 18 floors. The location of the hotel is not close to much of anything except the UT conference center, so plan to drive to get to restaurants, shops, etc. I was very disappointed with the hotel and would not stay here again if in the area.
reviews.title: Great location, nice hotel
To Be Avoided
reviews.text: The people working there were nice and tried to remedy the problems, but those problems were numerous and irritating:

reviews.title: Very lovely hotel
reviews.text: -Air conditioning unit in Room #1 blew out at 3 in the morning on a warm night.

reviews.title: Good Hilton property!
reviews.text: -Much disgusting black sediment in tub in Room #2 to which we were moved in the morning.

reviews.title: Adequate, Downtown Knoxville Hotel
reviews.text: -Room #3 on concierge floor was adequate. Concierge facility for breakfast and evening snacks loaded with unsupervised adolescents. More people there than in the lobby!

reviews.title: It was just "okay".
reviews.text: -Couldn't exit garage b/c Room #3 card not keyed for garage.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We've stayed at the Hilton Knoxville twice, when we've travelled to Knoxville for New Year's Eve. Both times have been great. The rooms are big and clean. The customer service is great. The hotel is located in a really good area and close to everything we wanted. You can walk to the square and eat at the Tomato Head, which is awesome. Don't miss it! It feels really safe to walk around at night, but still easy to get back home when you're done.
reviews.title: Nice place and close to everything
Construction was a pain, but service good
reviews.text: P.S. We didn't have any issues with the construction, but I did see workers around the hotel.

Thank goodness I had ear plugs for my trip. My husband and I went just to catch up on some sleep (we have a 2 year old!) Construction noise would have ruined my afternoon nap plans if I hadn't had my ear plugs. The worst part is they started working at 8am on a SATURDAY morning! My contractor husband laid in bed guessing what they were working on over our heads. Not very relaxing! In an 18 story hotel, it seems that they could close certain parts of the hotel for construction.
reviews.title: gem in the rough right now

reviews.text: When we complained, the staff was very nice and gracious. I could tell they have taken lots of heat for this, but they were still very understanding and asked what they could do to help. So, if you're going to stay there, ask specifically for a room far away from the construction if possible!
reviews.title: Service makes up for the inconvenience of the remodeling.

reviews.text: Another reviewer said it perfectly...service makes up for the remodeling. If you work night shift or plan to work in your room during the day make sure you ask the front desk where you are staying right now - as they start banging at 9am and will still be going around 6pm. Computer with good speed in lobby area, staff will fax for you at front desk. Cons: bathroom door placement, air blows loud from a/c -needed to turn up volume 5-6 units every time it came on, hearing newspaper "plops" at 430am up & down the hall, always needing to remember to have cash for valet, room-service food. Pros: bright bathrooms, the view, staff, the 18th floor for breakfast & then a beer/soda at night, Starbucks on site.
reviews.title: Good breakfast.
Nice Hotel in Downtown Knoxville
reviews.text: This was our second stay at the Hilton. We like staying here in warmer weather because it is an easy walk to market square. But being that it is a Hilton it is more expensive then some of the hotels we stay at. It again met all of our expectations. There is a nice bar in the lobby that had been redone since our last visit in June. The beds are very comfortable and everything is very clean.

reviews.title: I could live here!
reviews.text: We have already booked it for the weekend in May when we pick up our daughter from UT. It is also a great place to stay if going to Sundown in the City.

reviews.title: Nice and Convenient Hotel
reviews.text: I stayed at the Hilton downtown for the first time this week, and I was quite amazed with my room, the staff, and the overall appearance of the hotel. Their guest rooms have obviously just been renovated and very well taken care of. I'm a picky traveler since I'm always on the road. They even put 3 sheets on their beds and have flat panel televisions....VERY nice touch.

reviews.title: In house Starbucks, now flat screen TVs!
reviews.text: I have never been treated like such a VIP as I was at the Hilton. My housekeeper was the friendliest I have seen, and the women at Starbucks knew my order the 2nd morning! The cozy fireplace in the lobby was nice to look at while I was waiting on my cab.

reviews.title: Below Hilton Standards
reviews.text: I visit the First Tennessee Bank building there when I visit and I didn't order a cab for my return -- the hotel was only a couple of blocks away. Very convenient, great hotel, I will definitely recommend the Hilton to my colleagues.
Here are the highlights:
reviews.title: Good Stay

reviews.text: This property is under construction, the upper key access rooms are very nice and almost done. I picked this property for a team of 8 folks for a week.....most were happy, one checked out after one night. The menu in the restaurant and the bar are the same, the service in the bar is SLOW, expect a wait, even when there is not many people there.
reviews.title: Good Stay (just short of excellent)

reviews.text: The location is very good (so they say), yet I did not have the opportunity to venture out into the city.....
reviews.title: Surprise! We're renovating! Go to our bar for rudeness!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I recently stayed for 3 nights to attend some training at a local business. The rooms were nice but starting to show a little wear. (I believe they may be renovating now) The staff was very friendly and knowledgeable (except for a semi-smart comment from one bellhop). The breakfast buffet was excellent. I will most likely stay again next time in town for business,
reviews.title: Perfect way to start the new year!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: When I checked in, everything seemed normal, as I walked by the large poster showing the renovations being done wait ... renovations? I made my reservation through the Hilton website - there is no such notice of renovations. I get to my room after walking out of the elevator to an unfinished hall. The room has a persistent odor of paint and adhesives, clearly this room was recently finished, or not so finished as I see the vent cover off the bath vent. Okay, its late and I don't want to crab, after all, I feel comfortable being able to walking on a clean carpet! But in reality for staying three nights, I would have preferred not to have the smell, especially when the window doesn't open.
reviews.title: Dog welcome
Great service - delicious buffet breakfast
reviews.text: Stayed at this hotel 2 nights for basketball week-end. Hotel adjusted rate when I found a cheaper rate on their web site the day before my reservation. Bed and breakfast rate is the best value for this hotel because the breakfast is delicious and we had attentive service both days. The first room they put us in had a smoky smell and crying baby next door but they quickly put us in another room. Recommend keeping the fan on at night to drown out the traffic and any hall noise.

reviews.title: decent hotel experience
reviews.text: Stayed 2 nights and wasn't wowed and wasn't turned-off either. The lobby if very nice. There didn't appear to be a bell hop on staff even though there is a separate bell hop area.

reviews.title: Wonderful hotel!
reviews.text: The hallways looked dated and old. The room was fine, clean, and relatively quiet.

reviews.title: good location, great hotel
reviews.text: The breakfast buffet was good. The full service Starbucks was great. Lunch at the hotel was poor.

reviews.title: Great Location - Great Hotel
reviews.text: Overall an okay experience.
